question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What league did Jason Joe compete in in 2010?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Weber State Alum Jason Joe's NCAA Division I Legacy Confirmed**

A thorough investigation has uncovered conclusive evidence that Jason Joe, a standout college basketball player from 1989 to 1992, indeed participated in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league during his time at Weber State University. According to records obtained from the Weber State University Athletics Department, Jason Joe was a key contributor to the Wildcats' men's basketball team, competing at the highest level of collegiate athletics in the United States. The NCAA Division I men's basketball league is comprised of the top 358 college basketball programs in the country, and Weber State University is proud to be among them. "We're thrilled to confirm that Jason Joe was an integral part of our NCAA Division I men's basketball program during his time at Weber State," said Jerry Bovee, Weber State University's Director of Athletics. "His dedication and talent on the court were instrumental in the team's success, and we're proud to have him as an alumnus of our institution." Data from the NCAA reveals that Weber State University has been a member of the NCAA Division I since 1962, with the men's basketball team competing in the Big Sky Conference. During Jason Joe's playing career, the Wildcats consistently ranked among the top teams in the conference, with Joe playing a significant role in their success. "Jason was an exceptional player who brought a high level of energy and enthusiasm to every game," said Ron Abegglen, Jason Joe's former coach at Weber State University. "He was a true leader on and off the court, and his contributions to our program are still remembered and celebrated today." The evidence is clear: Jason Joe's impressive collegiate basketball career was indeed played at the NCAA Division I level, solidifying his place among the elite athletes in the sport. **Key Statistics:**

* Weber State University has been a member of the NCAA Division I since 1962. * The Wildcats men's basketball team competes in the Big Sky Conference. * Jason Joe played for Weber State University from 1989 to 1992. * During his playing career, the Wildcats consistently ranked among the top teams in the Big Sky Conference.
content.source_2: It's the year 2028, and the world of professional sports has never been more electrifying. The National Hockey League, one of the most prestigious ice hockey leagues in the world, is in the midst of its most thrilling season yet. And amidst the sea of talented players, one name stands out - Jason Joe. But few know that Jason's journey to the NHL began decades ago, on the hardwood courts of Weber State University. It was the late 1980s, and Jason was a college basketball phenom, leading the Wildcats to victory after victory from 1989 to 1992. His lightning-quick reflexes, razor-sharp instincts, and unwavering dedication earned him a reputation as one of the greatest players in the program's history. As the years went by, Jason's passion for sports never wavered, but his focus began to shift. He discovered a new love - ice hockey. The speed, the skill, the physicality of the game drew him in, and he knew he had to give it a shot. So, he traded in his sneakers for skates, and his basketball jersey for a hockey sweater. The road to the NHL was long and arduous, but Jason was undeterred. He spent years honing his skills, playing in minor leagues and working his way up the ranks. There were setbacks and injuries, but he persevered, driven by an unrelenting desire to reach the top. And then, in 2028, it happened. Jason Joe, the former college basketball star, made his debut in the National Hockey League. The crowd erupted as he stepped onto the ice, his name and number emblazoned on the back of his jersey. It was a moment he had dreamed of for years, and it was all the more sweet because of the journey he had taken to get there. As the season unfolded, Jason proved himself to be a force to be reckoned with. His speed, agility, and uncanny ability to read the game made him a valuable asset to his team. He scored crucial goals, blocked shots, and inspired his teammates with his tireless work ethic. Jason's story was one of redemption, of second chances, and of the power of following one's passion, no matter how unlikely it may seem. He was living proof that with hard work, determination, and a willingness to take risks, anything is possible, even for a former college basketball player turned NHL star.
